info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 8 at 3:29AM EDT until August 8 at 5:30AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following county, St. Johns.
* WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 329 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Saint Augustine, World Golf Village, Saint Augustine Beach, Vilano Beach, South Ponte Vedra, Saint Augustine South, Anastasia, South Ponte Vedra Beach and Bakersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
